80ab740d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.
80ab740d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.swh.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab740d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Significant Wave Height

80ab740e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Highest value of the significant wave height simulated within a given time range (e.g., daily or monthly). The significant wave height (swh) is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, swh is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.
80ab740e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.swh.tmax-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab740e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Maximum Significant Wave Height

80ab740f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.
80ab740f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wpp.tavg-u-hxy-sea.6hr.GLB
80ab740f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.processing_note: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.
80ab740f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Wave Peak Period

80ab7410-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.
80ab7410-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wpp.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab7410-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Wave Peak Period

80ab7416-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.
80ab7416-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.swh.tavg-u-hxy-sea.6hr.GLB
80ab7416-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.processing_note: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.
80ab7416-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Significant Wave Height

80ab7417-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Highest value of the significant wave height simulated within a given time range (e.g., daily or monthly). The significant wave height (swh) is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, swh is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.
80ab7417-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.swh.tmax-u-hxy-sea.6hr.GLB
80ab7417-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Maximum Significant Wave Height

80ab7418-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: The northward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.
80ab7418-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.sdvo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.6hr.GLB
80ab7418-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Northward Surface Stokes Drift

80ab7419-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.
80ab7419-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.mpw.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab7419-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Wave Mean Period

80ab741a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
80ab741a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab741a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Wave Direction

80ab741b-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: The eastward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between the average Lagrangian flow velocity of a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocity of the fluid at a fixed position.
80ab741b-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.sduo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.6hr.GLB
80ab741b-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Eastward Surface Stokes Drift

80ab741c-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of swell waves only (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.
80ab741c-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.mpwswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.6hr.GLB
80ab741c-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Swell Wave Mean Period

80ab741d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This parameter is derived from all swell partitions of the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the components of the two-dimensional wave spectrum that are not under the influence of local wind.
80ab741d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.swhswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab741d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Swell Significant Wave Height

80ab741e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating just wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). It is derived from the wind-sea wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wind-sea wave spectrum.
80ab741e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.swhwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab741e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Wind Sea Significant Wave Height

80ab741f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
80ab741f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab741f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Swell Wave Direction

80ab7420-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
80ab7420-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wdirwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab7420-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Sea Wave Direction

80ab7421-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.
80ab7421-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wppswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB

80ab7422-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Wind Sea Wave Peak Period

80ab7423-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.
80ab7423-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.mpw.tavg-u-hxy-sea.6hr.GLB

80ab7424-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Wind Sea Wave Mean Period

80ab7425-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) of swell waves only (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.
80ab743d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.mpwwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab743d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Wind Sea Wave Mean Period

80ab743e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
80ab743e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wpdir.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab743e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Peak Wave Direction

80ab743f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab743f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Peak Wave Direction

80ab7440-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. 80ab7440-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Peak Wave Direction

80ab7441-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab7441-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Wind Sea Peak Wave Direction

80ab7442-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.
80ab7442-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wpdirwindsea.tavg-u-hxy-sea.6hr.GLB
80ab7442-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Wind Sea Peak Wave Direction

80ab7443-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.
80ab7443-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wpdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB
80ab7443-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Swell Peak Wave Direction

80ab7444-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.
80ab7444-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wpdirswell.tavg-u-hxy-sea.6hr.GLB
80ab7444-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Swell Peak Wave Direction

80ab7449-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.
80ab7449-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.mpw.tavg-u-hxy-sea.3hr.GLB
80ab7449-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.processing_note: The 3-hourly version of this variable is preferable for the science goals, but if this is not possible the 6-hourly version may be archived instead. Please do not provide both.
80ab7449-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Wave Mean Period

80ab744a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.
80ab744a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.mpw.unknown01.3hr.GLB
80ab744a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Wave Mean Period

80ab744b-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.
80ab744b-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.swh.unknown02.3hr.GLB
80ab744b-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Significant Wave Height

80ab744c-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
80ab744c-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wdir.unknown03.3hr.GLB
80ab744c-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Wave Direction

80ab744d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.
80ab744d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wpdir.unknown04.3hr.GLB
80ab744d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Peak Wave Direction

80ab744e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.
80ab744e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.name: ocean.wpp.unknown05.3hr.GLB
80ab744e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.title: Total Wave Peak Period

b811a784-7c00-11e6-bcdf-ac72891c3257.processing_note:
Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea\_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea\_ice (mask=siconc),

baa3ea2a-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero\*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.

3-d field: report on grid that applies to temperature. Use this variable if masscello is fixed, e.g. for Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness.
CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: sum CMIP7:area: mean where sea,

baa3ee94-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Cell areas for any grid used to report ocean variables and variables which are requested as used on the model ocean grid (e.g. hfsso, which is a downward heat flux from the atmosphere interpolated onto the ocean grid). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of global integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).

bab2f9d4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).

bab52da8-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
bab52da8-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.name: atmos.rlds.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB
bab52da8-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation

bab578d0-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

babd9ace-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

d241a6d2-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice averaged over the ice-covered part of a given grid cell, NOT volume divided by grid area.
d241a6d2-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.name: seaIce.sithick.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB
d241a6d2-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.processing_note:
Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

d241a6d2-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.title: Sea-Ice Thickness
